lessons.japanese: 技術が追いつくまでに5年はかかるだろう。
lessons.indonesian: It must be five years before the technology catches up.

lessons.japanese: 近代科学技術はなぜ中国で発展しなかったのだろうか。
lessons.indonesian: Why didn't modern technology develop in China?

lessons.japanese: 興奮した群衆が競技場から溢れ出てきた。
lessons.indonesian: The excited crowd poured out of the stadium.

lessons.japanese: 競技場へ行くのにどれくらい時間がかかりますか。
lessons.indonesian: How long does it take to get to the stadium?

lessons.japanese: 競技場にはどうやって行ったの？
lessons.indonesian: How did you get to the stadium?

lessons.japanese: 競技者は気迫と自信に満ちていた。
lessons.indonesian: The athlete was full of spirit and confidence.

lessons.japanese: 競技は予定どおりに進行した。
lessons.indonesian: The athletic meeting went on as scheduled.

lessons.japanese: 技術者は太陽のエネルギーに夢中になっている。
lessons.indonesian: Engineers are crazy about solar energy.

lessons.japanese: 技術者は自然を知ろうとするよりはむしろ利用しようとする。
lessons.indonesian: The engineer seeks not so much to know nature as to make use of it.

lessons.japanese: 技術者の不足が当社の発展の最大のネックだ。
lessons.indonesian: The shortage of engineers is the greatest bottleneck to the development of our company.

lessons.japanese: 技術革新は情報産業に急速な進歩をもたらした。
lessons.indonesian: Technological innovation brought about the rapid progress of the information industry.

lessons.japanese: 技術革新のおかげで、その工場の最大生産量は２倍になった。
lessons.indonesian: Thanks to the technological innovation, the maximum output of the factory has doubled.
The engineer climbed the telephone pole.

lessons.japanese: 技師がその高性能なシステムの操作方法を実演してくれた。
lessons.indonesian: The engineer demonstrated how to operate the sophisticated system.
